item.title: King Charles III's Coronation to Draw Global Audience for Lavish Ceremony
item.description: The coronation ceremony dates back 1,000 years, a throwback to a bygone age when all-powerful monarchs dictated the fates of nations.

item.title: King Charles Inherits Bulging Royal Purse Thanks to Property Boom
item.description: Behind the royal wealth is a booming real-estate portfolio of bucolic farms, wholesale warehouses and prime London offices that has helped cover a royal spending spree.

item.title: Will Powerful New Tools FinallyLet Us Hear Alien Civilizations?
item.description: The most powerful effort yet to find extraterrestrial life is searching for beings that may not want to be found.

item.title: Vice Media is nearing a deal for senior lenders to acquire it out of bankruptcy, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.description: Vice Media is nearing a deal for senior lenders to acquire it out of bankruptcy, according to people familiar with the matter.

item.title: Weight-loss brand Jenny Craig said that it is going out of business.
item.description: Weight-loss brand Jenny Craig said that it is going out of business.

item.title: The leader of Russian paramilitary group Wagner threatened to withdraw his troops from the front line in Ukraine, citing growing losses, in a move that raises fresh tensions between Moscow's military leaders ahead of an expected offensive by Kyiv.
item.description: The leader of Russian paramilitary group Wagner threatened to withdraw his troops from the front line in Ukraine, citing growing losses, in a move that raises fresh tensions between Moscow’s military leaders ahead of an expected offensive by Kyiv.

item.title: A statue in Hong Kong commemorating the Tiananmen massacre was seized by police, the sculptor said.
item.description: A statue in Hong Kong commemorating the Tiananmen massacre was seized by police, the sculptor said.

item.title: The WHO declared an end to the Covid-19 emergency, signaling that one of the most deadly and economically devastating pandemics in modern history is receding as the disease that caused it becomes a routine illness.
item.description: The WHO declared an end to the Covid-19 emergency, signaling that one of the most deadly and economically devastating pandemics in modern history is receding as the disease that caused it becomes a routine illness.

item.title: Warner Bros. Discovery's direct-to-consumer streaming platforms will be profitable in 2023, a year earlier than projected, the company said.
item.description: Warner Bros. Discovery’s direct-to-consumer streaming platforms will be profitable in 2023, a year earlier than projected, the company said.

item.title: Walensky will be stepping down as director of the CDC in June, the agency said, as the Biden administration prepares to end the national health emergency around Covid-19 next week.
item.description: Walensky will be stepping down as director of the CDC in June, the agency said, as the Biden administration prepares to end the national health emergency around Covid-19 next week.

item.title: U.S. stocks rallied following the jobs report, capping a tumultuous week. The S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow gained 1.8%, 2.2% and 1.7%, respectively.
item.description: U.S. stocks rallied following the jobs report, capping a tumultuous week. The S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow gained 1.8%, 2.2% and 1.7%, respectively.

item.title: Shares of under-fire regional banks surged to recover some lost ground, though many still ended the week nursing hefty losses.
item.description: Shares of under-fire regional banks surged to recover some lost ground, though many still ended the week nursing hefty losses.

item.title: Americans landed jobs and their wages increased in April, showing the labor market remained resilient amid banking turmoil, rising interest rates and high inflation. Employers added 253,000 jobs and the unemployment rate fell to 3.4%.
item.description: Americans landed jobs and their wages increased in April, showing the labor market remained resilient amid banking turmoil, rising interest rates and high inflation. Employers added 253,000 jobs and the unemployment rate fell to 3.4%.

item.title: For at least a year, some employees at TikTok were able to find what they described internally as a list of users who watch gay content on the app, a collection of information that sparked worker complaints, according to ex-TikTok employees.
item.description: For at least a year, some employees at TikTok were able to find what they described internally as a list of users who watch gay content on the app, a collection of information that sparked worker complaints, according to ex-TikTok employees.

item.title: Hedge-fund manager Louis Bacon was awarded $203 million in damages and legal fees in a defamation case against former retail mogul Peter Nygard.
item.description: Hedge-fund manager Louis Bacon was awarded $203 million in damages and legal fees in a defamation case against former retail mogul Peter Nygard.

item.title: Special counsel Smith is racing through a roster of interviews, including with Pence and other top aides to Trump, as he contemplates filing charges in his wide-ranging probes related to Trump, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.description: Special counsel Smith is racing through a roster of interviews, including with Pence and other top aides to Trump, as he contemplates filing charges in his wide-ranging probes related to Trump, according to people familiar with the matter.

item.title: Google Retools to Stay at the Top of Search
item.description: The changes aim to respond to big shifts in the way people access information on the internet, including the emergence of AI bots like ChatGPT.

item.title: Fashion's Latest Comeback? Actually Wearable Clothes
item.description: Outrageous Instagram clothes are passé. Look up from your phone and enter the era of stunningly subtle, expertly cut “un-shouty chic.”
